title: C++ Break
text: You have already seen the break statement used in an earlier chapter of this tutorial. It was used to "jump out" of a switch statement.

The break statement can also be used to jump out of a 
loop.
This example jumps out of the loop when i is equal to 4:

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {  if (i == 4) {    
  break;  }  cout << i << "\n";}

title: C++ Continue
text: The continue statement breaks one iteration (in the loop), if a specified condition occurs, and continues with the next iteration in the loop.
This example skips the value of 4:

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {  if (i == 4) {    
  continue;  }  cout << i << "\n";}

title: Break and Continue in While Loop
text: You can also use break and continue in while loops:

examples.heading: Break Example
Continue Example
examples.code:
int i = 0;while (i < 10) {  if (i == 4) {    i++;    continue;
    }  cout << i << "\n";  i++;}
